person.persName: William Milo Stone (Sixth governor of Iowa, attorney, and judge.)

body.p: Sixth governor of Iowa, attorney, newspaper editor, judge, and soldier. Jefferson County, New York, native. Son of Truman F. Stone and Lavina North Stone. Married to Caroline M. Mathews Stone in 1858. Father of William Stone. Chairmaker in Coschocton County, Ohio, in 1850. Admitted to the bar in 1851. Attorney in Marion County, Iowa, in 1854. Editor of The Knoxville Journal in Marion County in 1855. Presidential elector for the Republican Party from Iowa in 1856. District judge in Marion County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Iowa Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain and major from June 8, 1861, to September 9, 1862. Captured at the Battle of Shiloh, Hardin County, Tennessee, in April 1862. Served in the 22nd Iowa Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a colonel from September 9, 1862, to August 13, 1863. Republican Governor of the State of Iowa from January 14, 1864, to January 16, 1868. Appointed brevet brigadier general of volunteers on March 13, 1865.
